keyEvents.title: Five Elders Debut at Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: The Five Elders meet at Mary Geoise to discuss critical world events including Shanks and Whitebeard.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of the World Government's most sacred city and seat of power.

keyEvents.title: Emergency Warlord Meeting
keyEvents.description: Sengoku convenes an emergency meeting of the Seven Warlords at Mary Geoise to find Crocodile's replacement.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Mary Geoise as the center of World Government military operations.

keyEvents.title: Laffitte Infiltrates Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: Laffitte somehow bypasses all security to infiltrate the Warlord meeting.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates that even the World Government's most secure location can be breached.

description: Mary Geoise is the capital of the World Government, located at the summit of the Red Line. It is the holiest land in the One Piece world and serves as the headquarters for the World Government and the home of the Celestial Dragons.
significance: The political center of the One Piece world and seat of ultimate authority.
geographicFeatures: Located at the peak of the Red Line
Separates the first and second halves of the Grand Line

reveals.information: Serves as the meeting place for critical World Government decisions
Despite high security, can be infiltrated by skilled individuals

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Bellamy Confrontation
keyEvents.description: Luffy confronts Bellamy at a Mock Town bar to retrieve Cricket's stolen gold.
keyEvents.significance: The climax of the Mock Town conflict.

keyEvents.title: Bellamy's Defeat
keyEvents.description: Luffy defeats Bellamy with one punch in Mock Town, shocking all witnesses.
keyEvents.significance: Proves Luffy's overwhelming power and validates belief in dreams.

keyEvents.title: Blackbeard Appears in Mock Town
keyEvents.description: Marshall D. Teach makes his first physical appearance in Mock Town.
keyEvents.significance: Sets the stage for future encounters between Luffy and Blackbeard.

description: Mock Town is a lawless pirate haven on Jaya Island where dreams are mocked and only strength matters. It's filled with bars, gambling dens, and violence.
significance: The setting for Luffy's confrontation with Bellamy and Blackbeard's first appearance.
geographicFeatures: Filled with bars and establishments catering to pirates
